info.name: HMS-JonathanCastillo
info.description:
These endpoints will cover the healt management system (hms) to simulate a real backend of a real hospital app where are different roles:

- Patient: Which can create, read, list and delete appointments
- Doctor: Which can read list and manage the dates of the appointments
- Admin: Which can create new doctors, reactivate the user accounts, and list all appointments.

item.name: User routes

request.description:
This route allows a user to sign up as a patient, a user has to provide the following information:

- Displayname
- Email
- Password

This route allow users to disable their account by using their valid tokens and providing a body:

- disabled as true

item.description:
These routes allows any person to:

1. Create an acccount as a patient.
2. Generate a token once an account was created (simulation of a login).
3. Allow users to delete their accounts (Need authorization via tokens)

item.name: Patient routes

request.description:
This route allows a patient to create a new appointment, the patient has to provide the following information in the body:

- Doctor id
- Date
    

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

item.name: Read an appointment of the patient by id

request.description:
This route allows a patient to read an appointment by passing the appointment id as param (only an appointment id related to the authenticated patient will be valid).

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

item.name: List the appointments of the patient

request.description:
This route will allow patients to see all their appointments (only appointments related to the authenticated patient will be displayed).

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

To use pagination in this route is necessary to assign two params:

- offset: Param to set the start point to search
- limit: The amount of items that will be displayed
    

Both receive numbers.

**By default, offset is set on 0 and limit on 5.**

This route allows a patient to delete an appointment by passing an appointment id as param (only an appointment id related to the authenticated patient will be valid).

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

item.description:
These routes allows any patient to:

1. Generate a patient token
2. Create a new appointment
3. Get an appointment by passing an appointment id
4. List the appointments of the user
5. Delete an appointment by passing an appointment id

item.name: Doctor routes
List all appointments of the doctor

request.description:
This route will allow doctors to see all their appointments (only appointments related to the authenticated doctor will be displayed).

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

To use pagination in this route is necessary to assign two params:

- offset: Param to set the start point to search
- limit: The amount of items that will be displayed
    

Both receive numbers.

**By default, offset is set on 0 and limit on 5.**

To allow a doctor to filter appointments by date is necessary to asign a param:

- dateFilter
    

Receive a string with the date

To allow a doctor to filter appointments by patient is necessary to asign a param:

- patientFilter
    

Receives a number with the patient id

To allow a doctor to order appointments by newest is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string with a "ASC"

To allow a doctor to order appointments by oldest is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string with a "DESC"

Thise route will allow a doctor to change the date of an appointment by passing the appointment id as param (only an appointment id related to the authenticated doctor will be valid) and the new date in the body:

- newDate
    

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

item.description:
These routes allows any doctor to:

1. Generate a doctor token
2. List all appointments of the doctor
3. Change the date of an appointment

item.name: Admin routes

request.description:
This routes will allow an admin to create a new doctor, the admin has to provide the following information:

- Displayname
- Email
- password
- departmentId
    

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

item.name: Change the isDisabled property of user

request.description:
This route will allow the admin to reactivate the users accounts by passing a user id as param and the following information in the body:

- Disabled as false
    

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

This route will allow the admin to list all the appointments.

**Bearer token needed to access this route.**

To use pagination in this route is necessary to assign two params:

- offset: Param to set the start point to search
- limit: The amount of items that will be displayed
    

Both receive numbers.

**By default, offset is set on 0 and limit on 5.**

To allow an admin to filter appointments by patient is necessary to asign a param:

- patientId
    

Recieves a number with the patient id

To allow an admin to filter appointments by doctor is necessary to asign a param:

- doctorId
    

Recieves a number with the doctor id

To allow an admin to filter appointments by actives is necessary to asign a param:

- appointmentActives
    

Recieves a true

To allow an admin to filter appointments by inactives is necessary to asign a param:

- appointmentActives
    

Recieves a false

To allow an admin to filter appointments by patient's newest appointment is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string that is divided by a "-":

patient-1-ASC

1. The word "patient"
2. Patient id
3. Order ASC

To allow an admin to filter appointments by patient's oldest appointment is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string that is divided by a "-":

patient-1-DESC

1. The word "patient"
2. Patient id
3. Order DESC

To allow an admin to filter appointments by doctor's newest appointment is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string that is divided by a "-":

doctor-1-ASC

1. The word "doctor"
2. Doctor id
3. Order ASC

To allow an admin to filter appointments by doctor's oldest appointment is necessary to asign a param:

- orderBy
    

Recieves a string that is divided by a "-":

doctor-1-DESC

1. The word "doctor"
2. Doctor id
3. Order DESC

item.description:
These routes will allow any admin to:

1. Generate admin tokens
2. Create new doctors
3. Reactivate the users accounts
4. List all the appointments
